quality_assessment: Excellent comprehensive overview page with accurate documentation, clear examples, and effective visual diagrams. Minor enhancements possible for completeness.

issues.description: Agent timeout configuration is not mentioned in the overview
issues.fix_suggestion: Consider adding a brief mention of agent_timeout_secs option in the map phase configuration table or capabilities list

issues.description: commit_required option for commands not documented in overview
issues.fix_suggestion: Add a brief note about commit_required option which enforces commit creation (Spec 163), potentially with cross-reference to detailed docs

positive_aspects: Excellent mermaid diagrams showing execution flow and worktree isolation architecture
Clear explanation of the three MapReduce phases (setup, map, reduce)
Accurate code examples with source file annotations
Proper use of MkDocs Material admonitions (tip, note, warning, example)
Comprehensive work distribution section covering JSONPath, filtering, sorting, pagination, and deduplication
Good coverage of parallel execution and agent isolation benefits
Accurate DLQ documentation including json_log_location for debugging
Correct checkpoint and resume commands documented
Excellent 'When to Use' guidance for MapReduce vs standard workflows
Complete 'Learn More' section with valid cross-references to all related pages
Best practice tips for testing with small subsets first
improvement_suggestions: Add brief mention of agent_timeout_secs configuration option for controlling per-agent timeouts
Consider mentioning commit_required feature for ensuring agents commit their changes
Could add a brief note about custom merge workflows for advanced use cases
Consider adding a link to troubleshooting.md in the 'Learn More' section

metadata.validation_focus: Auto-discovered page - check for drift and enhance with visual features
